name: Giant Pufferfish
description: The Giant Pufferfish has a small, rounded body covered in sharp spines that it can inflate when threatened, becoming noticeably larger and more menacing.
memorable: Its ability to puff up and inflict piercing damage deters melee attackers, making it a formidable presence in its aquatic environment.
goals: The Giant Pufferfish primarily seeks to defend itself in underwater habitats and deter potential threats.
relations: It may be encountered alongside other aquatic creatures in coral reefs or other marine environments.
environment: Typically found in aquatic environments like coral reefs or ocean floors.
strengths: High Strength and Constitution provide durability and significant damage output, particularly when puffed up.
weaknesses: Immobile on land, making it vulnerable if encountered outside of its natural underwater habitat.
attacks: Employs a strong bite and spines to inflict piercing pain, and it can poison attackers.
most_powerful_ability: Puff Up: Increases size and damage output for 1 minute, enhancing its combat effectiveness.
senses: Has darkvision that allows it to see in dim light and darkness up to 60 feet.
skills: Possesses a passive perception of 12, allowing it to sense most nearby threats.
additional_information: Immune to poison damage and cannot be poisoned.
Utilizes a unique Spiny Body defense mechanism against melee attackers.
Can breathe only underwater, limiting its movement options outside of water.
Recharges its Puff Up ability after a short or long rest.
Spines deal additional poison damage to attackers who fail their saving throw.

pufferfish that breathes underwater and poisons foes
fish that retaliates with piercing damage
